content:
I am an Undergraduate NLP Researcher at the Language Technologies Research Center, IIIT Hyderabad. Currently, I am working on adversarial text generation, but I’m also generally interested in generative models and work on side projects on the same. I also have experience building commercial NLP tools using ML/DL.
Outside CS and ML, I love football, music, art and speedcubing.

title: Karthik Chintapalli

summary: The issues with GANs for text generation and the methods being used to combat them
title: GANs for Text Generation - Part 1

summary: Using Reinforcement Learning to combat the non-differentiability issue in text GANs.
title: GANs for Text Generation - Part 2: RL

summary: An automatic Question-Answering system based on Dynamic Memory Networks
title: Q&A System based on Memory Networks

summary: System that determines the credibility of news headlines, to combat fake news
title: News Credibility Determination

summary: System to identify authors of emails by learning their style. Useful for detecting identity fraud.
title: Email Author Identification

summary: An LLVM-based compiler for the decaf programming language. Includes Lexer, parser, abstract syntax tree,and LLVM IR.
title: Decaf Compiler using LLVM

summary: A fully-decentralized food delivery Dapp for the Ethereum blockchain using Solidity and Truffle
title: Decentralized Food Delivery using Blockchains

summary: An Ultimate TTT bot using minimax search with iterative deepening and alpha-beta pruning
title: 4x4 Ultimate Tic-Tac-Toe Bot
